attributes.action: Scrap the unfair Lifetime Allowance on pensions
attributes.additional_details: After £1 million in the pension pot a 55% tax rate would apply. For those lucky enough to have a defined benefit scheme the limit equates to £50,000. before the 55% tax would apply. The LTA allowance has also been reduced from its initial limit of £1.5 million to £1 million which gives uncertainty to savers
attributes.background: The Lifetime Allowance (LTA) is amount of money you can have in your pension pot before you start being taxed at the excess at 55%. The LTA is set at £1 million which would give an annual annuity of approximately £25,00 pa.
